title: CRITICS NEEDED :: Brief Critiques for a Casual Designer
content:
Hello -

I'm a design hobbyist without professional training trying my hand at some web/blog concepts. I have two web locations that need critique from qualified folks. Friends and fam are great, but they love and yes to death. After witnessing the hearty reviews typical of the Type Battles, I submit the following for appetites with sharp teeth.

1) My Website -- [http://www.benmyers.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.benmyers.org/)  
(I know the portfolio link is dead)

2) My Blog -- [http://www.honeyedmouth.blogspot.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.honeyedmouth.blogspot.com/)  
(I'm getting ready to consolidate and move this to my domain)

3) A website I'm working on for a friend -- [http://www.commonconstruction.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.commonconstruction.com/)

(This is my first time soliciting feedback. Anything you have to offer is appreciated)

Ben
author: Bohonkas

comments.content:
Hi-

The third site is great and all, but I'm sure

[Flashvillage](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.flashvillage.com/)

won't be too happy that you didn't credit them.

Also, you might want to change the contact info into a form, and not just a blank page with your name and e-mail.

You also need to title your pages, and not leave them as "blank document."

Here is another place where you can ask for feedback on web concepts: [http://www.conceptfeedback.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.conceptfeedback.com/ "http://www.conceptfeedback.com")

#1 I would tell people that part of the links are for pdf:s. The contact-page is unfinished.

#2 Can you modify it so that it wouldn´t be so wide, hard to read?

#3 Hard to click on the thin pages, I would try other kind of navigation.

@ Jim -- I will give Flash Village credit.

@ Miro -- you're right about the content width. I'll make a reduction to the column size in the template. I'm also finding the pages difficult to navigate, and while the concept is cool, it's not user friendly.

Cheers!

Miro,

I modified the width -- let me know if it's easier to read. Also, I'm working on the contact page. Thanks for the feedback!

I'm also considering scrapping the flash village template all together. The navigation may discourage people from checking out all the content.

Cheers

Hi Bohonkas!  
Yes the width is much better now, long lines are sooooooo hard to read on screen.

Also, I suggest again you to post these to [www.conceptfeedback.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.conceptfeedback.com/ "www.conceptfeedback.com"), you´ll receive plenty of feedback in no time.

There is also [http://www.feedbackarmy.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201093315/http:/www.feedbackarmy.com/ "http://www.feedbackarmy.com"), though it is based on Amazon's Mechanical Turk and thus requires very specific questions to filter out random reviewers.
